item.title: It's if_else statements all the way down...
item.description: I’ve been developing a package where I needed a function to take numerous different actions (different [mutations]()) depending on the values of different variables within each row of a dataframe. I started off by using a series of nested dplyr::if_else functions inside of a dplyr::mutate call. I ended up with a bit of a mess, perhaps a dozen or so if_else calls… that’s when I got some abuse from my colleague following a Github pull request.
